result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Dennis Suhm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,314 payable to Joseph N.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.

Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant was ordered to report to Dodge Correctional.
-
**08-25-15/ William W Brash**           
The Court ordered the JOC amended to reflect 55 days of sentence credit.
It is further ordered that the sentence is CONCURRENT with any other sentence
Concurrent with: with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek Dennis Suhm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order signed and filed.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
Count 1.
Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (13 pages) commencing JULY 7, 2015, received and filed.  jm
Reflects 08-25-15 Court order granting 55 days of sentence credit and concurrent sentence
Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copy sent to defendant and State.
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.

Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,314 payable to Joseph N.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Parties have stipulated to the resitution amount.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for zero days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-AODA treatment
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
The defendant was ordered to report to Dodge Correctional.
Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant Derek Dennis Suhm in court with attorney Yeng Kong Lee.  Defendant Derek Dennis Suhm in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Branch 21 is in jury trial and is unable to hear this matter.  This case will be heard by Branch 38. Parties notified. Case sent forthwith.
Notice of appearance.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, TUESDAY, JULY 07, 2015 AT 8:30 A.M. IN BR 21, CH RM 632. kl

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Derek Dennis Suhm not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  The Court unable to proceed with hearing on today as Branch 21 and ADA Jeremy Arn in jury trial for an unrelated matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
April 28, 1015 @ 8:30A in BR 21, CH Rm 632 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce appears telephonically, defendant Derek Dennis Suhm not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing.  Defense unable to appear in person on today due to medical issue.  New date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Derek Dennis Suhm not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defendant awaiting revocation proceedings.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek Dennis Suhm in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Derek Dennis Suhm in custody.  Alex Mueller for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: JOSEPH S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derek Dennis Suhm in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Derek Dennis Suhm in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
